Key Match Events: Chris Flexen pitched a sharp performance, striking out seven in 6 1/3 innings for his first win since May 8, ending a 23-start winless streak.
Post-Match Reflections: First baseman Andrew Vaughn expressed pride in the team's performance after the win.
Interim manager Grady Sizemore highlighted the team's excitement for upcoming games and their competitive spirit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox improved to 39-120, tying with the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record for losses.
The Angels set a franchise record for losses in a season, dropping to 63-96.
The White Sox scored a season-high seven runs in the fifth inning, with Andrew Vaughn hitting a two-run single and Lenyn Sosa doubling home two more runs.

Zach Neto got hurt when he tried to take second on a pitch in the dirt in the fourth inning.
Los Angeles Angels' Tyler Anderson allowed five runs, four earned, and four hits in 4 1/3 innings.
